Posts.EditableText: I'm trying to test my mpg but it just sit there waiting for response. any suggestions. ports are the same. ip correct.
Posts.HTML: I'm trying to test my mpg but it just sit there waiting for response. any suggestions. ports are the same. ip correct.

Posts.EditableText: firstly, dont connect to your IP, connect to "localhost"
Posts.HTML: firstly, dont connect to your IP, connect to "localhost"

Posts.EditableText: done that and also doesn't do anything
Posts.HTML: done that and also doesn't do anything

Posts.EditableText:
strange....

so you got it on port 10001, and you are connecting to localhost?  make sure you got questnet running, lol.  make sure both ports are the same, make sure you have a game loaded in questnet.  im not trying to make you look stupid, but its that simple.  i dont know why else it isnt connecting to your own computer
Posts.HTML:
strange....

so you got it on port 10001, and you are connecting to localhost? make sure you got questnet running, lol. make sure both ports are the same, make sure you have a game loaded in questnet. im not trying to make you look stupid, but its that simple. i dont know why else it isnt connecting to your own computer

Posts.EditableText:
Not localhost - try "127.0.0.1" without the "'s....

Erm, make sure no firewall is enabled - or if there is that the port is open....
Posts.HTML:
Not localhost - try "127.0.0.1" without the "'s....

Erm, make sure no firewall is enabled - or if there is that the port is open....

Posts.EditableText: thanks i'll keep messing with it, no i get error no such room when it goes to load maybe i'll start over.

Posts.EditableText:
Run-time error 401

Can't run non-modal form when modal form is displayed

????????
Posts.HTML:
Run-time error 401

Can't run non-modal form when modal form is displayed

????????

Posts.EditableText:
Set

[code:1a9tbnbz]
welcome off
[/code:1a9tbnbz]

in the "define options" block.
thank you that work great now
Posts.HTML: thank you that work great now

Posts.EditableText: for that room error, all you had to do was goto options and make sure the start room was right glad you got it sorted though
Posts.HTML: for that room error, all you had to do was goto options and make sure the start room was right glad you got it sorted though

Posts.EditableText: This solves the problem I was having too.  It was the firewall that was preventing me from connecting.  It seems so obvious now but I never thought about it.  So thank you.  (I guess my other mistake was posting on the QuestNet forum instead of here.)
